conclusion: Analyze the flow patterns and positions of baffles to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Baffles are labeled A, B, C, D, E, and F with arrows indicating the direction of flow.
Baffles block the flow of liquid from one container to another.
Baffles A, B, C, and D are placed in front of the containers; baffles E and F are placed behind the containers.
Liquid flows from container A through baffles A, B, C, and D into container E.
Liquid flows from container B through baffles B, C, and D into container F.
Liquid flows from container C through baffles C, D, and E into container F.
Liquid flows from container D through baffles D, E, and F into container E.
Final answer: Liquid flows from A, B, C, and D into E, and from B, C, and D into F.
